episodeTitle: Where the Island's Treasure Lies! Zenny Pirates Full Charge!
description: Zenny discovers the Marines have set a trap for the Straw Hats and decides to help them by sailing his ship down the mountain. When corrupt officer Minchey reveals his plan to steal Zenny's treasure, the Straw Hats intervene. After learning Zenny's treasure was eaten by goats, Moore strips Minchey of his rank and lets the crew go. Zenny resolves to pursue his dream of becoming a pirate despite his age.

events.title: Marine Fleet Surrounds Goat Island
events.description: Zenny spots a fleet of Marine ships surrounding the island and realizes they have set up a trap for the Straw Hat Pirates. The Marines, led by Minchey under Captain Moore's command, position themselves to capture the crew.
events.significance: Sets up the central conflict of the episode - the Straw Hats are trapped and need to escape the Marine ambush.

events.title: Zenny Decides to Help the Straw Hats
events.description: Despite his failing health and advanced age, Zenny makes the bold decision to help the Straw Hat Pirates escape the Marine trap. He decides to use his ship, which has been sitting on top of the mountain, to create a distraction.
events.significance: This moment showcases Zenny's courage and his growing bond with the Straw Hats. It also demonstrates the theme of pursuing dreams regardless of age or limitations.

quotes.text: I may be old, but I can still help my pirate friends!
quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Zenny deciding to aid the Straw Hats despite the danger

events.title: Zenny's Ship Slides Down the Mountain
events.description: With the help of his loyal goats, Zenny gets aboard his ship which begins sliding down the mountain toward the ocean. The dramatic descent creates a spectacular scene as the ship races downward.
events.significance: A visually memorable moment that demonstrates Zenny's determination and the unconventional way he finally gets his ship to the sea after years of building it.

events.title: Zenny Officially Declares Himself a Pirate
events.description: As his ship reaches the ocean, Zenny officially declares that he has become a pirate, fulfilling a lifelong dream. Despite his age and illness, he embraces his new identity with joy and determination.
events.significance: This is the culmination of Zenny's character arc in the Goat Island Arc. It reinforces One Piece's central theme that it's never too late to pursue your dreams and that age is no barrier to adventure.

quotes.text: I'm at sea now! I've officially become a pirate!
quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Zenny's joyful declaration upon reaching the ocean

events.title: Minchey Reveals His True Intentions
events.description: Chief Petty Officer Minchey shoots at Zenny and reveals his true plan: he has been using the search for the Straw Hats as a cover to steal Zenny's supposed treasure. He admits to paying off his subordinate Marines to help with his personal schemes.
events.significance: Exposes Minchey as the true antagonist of the arc and reveals the corruption within the Marine forces pursuing the Straw Hats. It also shows that not all Marines are honorable.

quotes.text: I've been paying off my men so they'd help me steal your treasure, old man!
quotes.speaker: Minchey
quotes.context: Minchey revealing his corrupt scheme to Zenny

events.title: Minchey Attacks Zenny
events.description: Minchey physically attacks the elderly Zenny, kicking him and demanding to know the location of his treasure. The assault causes Zenny to suffer chest pains from his heart condition.
events.significance: Demonstrates Minchey's villainy and lack of honor, attacking a sick old man for personal gain. This sets up the need for intervention by the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Tell me where the treasure is, or you won't live to see another day!
quotes.speaker: Minchey
quotes.context: Minchey threatening Zenny while attacking him

events.title: Robin's Abacus Throw Saves Zenny
events.description: Before Minchey can kill Zenny, Nico Robin intervenes by throwing an abacus at Minchey, disrupting his attack. This quick thinking saves Zenny's life and demonstrates Robin's protective nature toward allies.
events.significance: Shows Robin's resourcefulness and her integration with the crew. She acts quickly to protect someone the crew has befriended, showing her growing bonds with the Straw Hats.

events.title: Goats Trample Minchey
events.description: Following Robin's intervention, Zenny's loyal goats charge at Minchey and trample him, helping to defeat the corrupt Marine officer. The goats prove their worth as Zenny's true treasure and companions.
events.significance: Provides poetic justice as the goats - which ate Zenny's money but are his real treasure - help defeat the man seeking material wealth. Reinforces the theme that true treasure is companionship, not gold.

events.title: Chopper Treats Zenny's Injuries
events.description: The Going Merry reaches Zenny's position, and Chopper immediately rushes to provide medical treatment for Zenny's injuries and heart condition. Despite the danger from the Marines, Chopper prioritizes helping their friend.
events.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's dedication as a doctor and the Straw Hats' loyalty to those they consider friends, even in dangerous situations.

events.title: The Truth About Zenny's Treasure
events.description: Zenny reveals the truth about his supposed treasure: he had exchanged all his treasures for cash, but when he was attacked by pirates and marooned on the island, the goats ate all his money. This is why he considers the goats themselves his true treasure.
events.significance: This revelation reframes the entire arc. The treasure everyone sought never existed in the traditional sense. Instead, Zenny's real treasure is the companionship of the goats and his newfound friendship with the Straw Hats. This reinforces One Piece's recurring theme that friendship and dreams are more valuable than material wealth.

quotes.text: The goats ate all my cash when I was unconscious. They're my treasure now - they saved my life and gave me companionship.
quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Zenny explaining the truth about his treasure

events.title: Moore Strips Minchey of His Rank
events.description: Captain Moore, Minchey's superior officer, arrives and physically strips Minchey of his rank by tearing off his epaulets. Moore condemns Minchey as a disgrace to the Marines for his corruption and abuse of power.
events.significance: Shows that there are honorable Marines who uphold justice even within a flawed system. Moore's actions demonstrate that not all Marines are corrupt and that the organization has standards of conduct.

quotes.text: You're a disgrace to the Marines! I hereby strip you of your rank!
quotes.speaker: Moore
quotes.context: Moore punishing Minchey for his corruption

events.title: Moore Lets the Straw Hats Go
events.description: Captain Moore contacts Luffy and tells him that he has no interest in capturing Zenny or pursuing the Straw Hats. He essentially gives them a free pass to leave the area, showing respect for their role in exposing Minchey's corruption.
events.significance: Demonstrates Moore's sense of honor and justice. He recognizes that the Straw Hats helped expose corruption and chose to let them go. This shows the complex morality in One Piece where not all Marines are enemies.

quotes.text: I have no interest in capturing Zenny. You're free to go.
quotes.speaker: Moore
quotes.context: Moore showing mercy to the Straw Hats

events.title: Zenny Resolves to Pursue His Pirate Dream
events.description: Despite his age and heart condition, Zenny declares that he will not let his age stop him from becoming a pirate and going on adventures. He decides to return to the island, repair his ship properly, and set sail when he's ready.
events.significance: The culminating character moment for Zenny. His decision embodies One Piece's core message that dreams are worth pursuing no matter your circumstances. His determination inspires both the characters and viewers that it's never too late to chase your dreams.

quotes.text: My age won't stop me from becoming a pirate. I'll go on adventures for as long as I'm able!
quotes.speaker: Zenny
quotes.context: Zenny's final declaration of his dream

events.title: Straw Hats Depart Goat Island
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates say goodbye to Zenny and depart from Goat Island aboard the Going Merry. They leave behind a friend who has been inspired to pursue his dreams, and they continue their own journey toward their goals.
events.significance: Concludes the Goat Island Arc. The departure marks the end of a brief but meaningful adventure that reinforced the series' themes about dreams, friendship, and treasure's true meaning.

themes.description: The episode's central theme is that it's never too late to pursue your dreams. Zenny, an elderly man with a heart condition, refuses to give up on his dream of becoming a pirate despite what others might consider insurmountable obstacles.
themes.symbolism: The ship sliding down the mountain represents breaking free from the constraints that have held you back. The ocean represents freedom and new possibilities.
culturalReferences: Reflects Japanese cultural values about perseverance and finding purpose in later life

themes.description: The revelation that Zenny's goats ate his money but became his true treasure reinforces a recurring One Piece theme: material wealth is meaningless compared to friendship and companionship.
themes.symbolism: The goats represent true treasure - they saved Zenny's life, gave him companionship, and ultimately helped defeat Minchey. They are more valuable than any amount of gold.

themes.description: The contrast between Captain Moore and Minchey shows that organizations contain both honorable and corrupt individuals. Moore's punishment of Minchey demonstrates that justice can prevail even within flawed systems.
themes.symbolism: Moore tearing off Minchey's epaulets symbolizes the removal of unearned authority and the restoration of honor.

themes.description: The Straw Hats' influence on Zenny shows how living freely and pursuing your dreams can inspire others. Their friendship gives Zenny the courage to finally pursue his lifelong dream.
themes.symbolism: The Straw Hats represent freedom and the courage to chase dreams, which awakens similar desires in those they meet.

characterSpotlights.development: Zenny completes his character arc by fully embracing his dream of becoming a pirate. Despite his age and illness, he chooses to live freely and pursue adventure. His revelation about his treasure shows he has learned what truly matters in life.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Goat Island Arc is anime-only filler content and does not appear in the manga. This episode and the arc were created by Toei Animation to give Eiichiro Oda time to build a buffer between the manga and anime.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode of the three-episode Goat Island Arc, which is completely filler and does not appear in the manga.
The Goat Island Arc was excluded from the 4Kids English dub, which heavily edited and censored One Piece for American audiences.

trivia.fact: This episode reinforces one of One Piece's central themes that pursuing your dreams is worthwhile regardless of age or circumstances, a message that resonates throughout the entire series.
The episode's Japanese air date (December 22, 2002) placed it during the holiday season in Japan, with its heartwarming message fitting the timing.
Osamu Saka, who voices Zenny in Japanese, was a veteran voice actor who brought warmth and depth to elderly characters throughout his career.
This is the last episode to use 'Free Will' by Ruppina as its ending theme before it changes to the next ending song.
